title: Power vs current in a series circuit

content.question: Three identical resistors are connected in a series circuit with a variable power supply. A graph of the power <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> provided to the circuit as a function of current <math alttext="I" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above. Which of the following graphs shows the power dissipated by one of the resistors as a function of the current through that resistor?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a line in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled I, and the numbers 1.0 through 3.0, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled V, and the numbers 10 through 30, in increments of 10, are indicated. The line begins at the origin, and moves upwards and to the right at a constant rate, passing through approximately the points 1.0 comma 15 and 2.0 comma 30.

The figure presents the graph of a line in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled I, and the numbers 1.0 through 3.0, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled V, and the numbers 10 through 30, in increments of 10, are indicated. The line begins at the origin, and moves upward and to the right at a constant rate. The line passes through the points 1.0 comma 10, 2.0 comma 20, and 3.0 comma 30.

The figure presents the graph of a line in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled I, and the numbers 1.0 through 3.0, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled V, and the numbers 10 through 30, in increments of 10, are indicated. The line begins at the origin, and moves gradually upward and to the right at a constant rate. The line passes through the point 3.0 comma 10.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled I, and the numbers 1.0 through 3.0, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled V, and the numbers 10 through 30, in increments of 10, are indicated. The curve begins at the origin, and moves steeply upwards and to the right at an increasing rate. The curve passes through the points 1.0 comma 6 and 2.0 comma 30.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled I, and the numbers 1.0 through 3.0, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled V, and the numbers 10 through 30, in increments of 10, are indicated. The curve begins at the origin, and moves upwards and to the right at an increasing rate, passing approximately through the point 3.0 comma 15.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled I, and the numbers 1.0 through 3.0, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled V, and the numbers 10 through 30, in increments of 10, are indicated. The curve begins at the origin, and moves upwards and to the right at an increasing rate, passing approximately through the point 3.0 comma 15.
